trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: StorSimple Snapshot Manager is a Microsoft Management Console (MMC) snap-in that simplifies data protection and backup management in a Microsoft Azure StorSimple environment.
trans-unit.target: StorSimple Snapshot Manager is a Microsoft Management Console (MMC) snap-in that simplifies data protection and backup management in a Microsoft Azure StorSimple environment.

trans-unit.source: With StorSimple Snapshot Manager, you can manage Microsoft Azure StorSimple data in the data center and in the cloud as a single integrated storage solution, thus simplifying backup processes and reducing costs.
trans-unit.target: With StorSimple Snapshot Manager, you can manage Microsoft Azure StorSimple data in the data center and in the cloud as a single integrated storage solution, thus simplifying backup processes and reducing costs.

trans-unit.source: This overview introduces the StorSimple Snapshot Manager, describe its features, and explains its role in Microsoft Azure StorSimple.
trans-unit.target: This overview introduces the StorSimple Snapshot Manager, describe its features, and explains its role in Microsoft Azure StorSimple.

trans-unit.source: For an overview of the entire Microsoft Azure StorSimple system, including the StorSimple device, StorSimple Manager service, StorSimple Snapshot Manager, and StorSimple Adapter for SharePoint, see [What Is StorSimple?](storsimple-overview.md) and [What are the StorSimple components?](storsimple-components.md).
trans-unit.target: For an overview of the entire Microsoft Azure StorSimple system, including the StorSimple device, StorSimple Manager service, StorSimple Snapshot Manager, and StorSimple Adapter for SharePoint, see [What Is StorSimple?](storsimple-overview.md) and [What are the StorSimple components?](storsimple-components.md).

trans-unit.source: StorSimple Snapshot Manager purpose and architecture
trans-unit.target: StorSimple Snapshot Manager purpose and architecture

trans-unit.source: StorSimple Snapshot Manager provides a central management console that you can use to create consistent, point-in-time backup copies of local and cloud data.
trans-unit.target: StorSimple Snapshot Manager provides a central management console that you can use to create consistent, point-in-time backup copies of local and cloud data.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can use the console to:
trans-unit.target: For example, you can use the console to:

trans-unit.source: Configure, back up, and delete volumes.
trans-unit.target: Configure, back up, and delete volumes.

trans-unit.source: Configure volume groups to ensure that backed up data is application-consistent.
trans-unit.target: Configure volume groups to ensure that backed up data is application-consistent.

trans-unit.source: Manage backup policies so that data is backed up on a predetermined schedule.
trans-unit.target: Manage backup policies so that data is backed up on a predetermined schedule.

trans-unit.source: Create independent copies of data, which can be stored in the cloud and used for disaster recovery.
trans-unit.target: Create independent copies of data, which can be stored in the cloud and used for disaster recovery.

trans-unit.source: With StorSimple Snapshot Manager, you mount volumes and then configure them into volume groups, typically by application.
trans-unit.target: With StorSimple Snapshot Manager, you mount volumes and then configure them into volume groups, typically by application.

trans-unit.source: StorSimple Snapshot Manager uses these volume groups to generate backup copies that are application-consistent.
trans-unit.target: StorSimple Snapshot Manager uses these volume groups to generate backup copies that are application-consistent.

trans-unit.source: (Application consistency exists when all related files and databases are synchronized and represent the true state of the application at a specific point in time.)
trans-unit.target: (Application consistency exists when all related files and databases are synchronized and represent the true state of the application at a specific point in time.)

trans-unit.source: StorSimple Snapshot Manager backups take the form of incremental snapshots, which capture only the changes since the last backup.
trans-unit.target: StorSimple Snapshot Manager backups take the form of incremental snapshots, which capture only the changes since the last backup.

trans-unit.source: As a result, backups require less storage and can be created and restored quickly.
trans-unit.target: As a result, backups require less storage and can be created and restored quickly.

trans-unit.source: StorSimple Snapshot Manager uses the Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) to ensure that snapshots capture application-consistent data.
trans-unit.target: StorSimple Snapshot Manager uses the Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) to ensure that snapshots capture application-consistent data.

trans-unit.source: (For more information, go to the Integration with Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service section.) With StorSimple Snapshot Manager, you can create backup schedules or take immediate backups as needed.
trans-unit.target: (For more information, go to the Integration with Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service section.) With StorSimple Snapshot Manager, you can create backup schedules or take immediate backups as needed.

trans-unit.source: If you need to restore data from a backup, StorSimple Snapshot Manager lets you select from a catalog of local or cloud snapshots.
trans-unit.target: If you need to restore data from a backup, StorSimple Snapshot Manager lets you select from a catalog of local or cloud snapshots.

trans-unit.source: Azure StorSimple restores only the data that is needed as it is needed, which prevents delays in data availability during restore operations.)
trans-unit.target: Azure StorSimple restores only the data that is needed as it is needed, which prevents delays in data availability during restore operations.)

trans-unit.source: Support for multiple volume types
trans-unit.target: Support for multiple volume types

trans-unit.source: You can use the StorSimple Snapshot Manager to configure and back up the following types of volumes:
trans-unit.target: You can use the StorSimple Snapshot Manager to configure and back up the following types of volumes:

trans-unit.source: **Basic volumes** – A basic volume is a single partition on a basic disk.
trans-unit.target: **Basic volumes** – A basic volume is a single partition on a basic disk.

trans-unit.source: **Simple volumes** – A simple volume is a dynamic volume that contains disk space from a single dynamic disk.
trans-unit.target: **Simple volumes** – A simple volume is a dynamic volume that contains disk space from a single dynamic disk.

trans-unit.source: A simple volume consists of a single region on a disk or multiple regions that are linked together on the same disk.
trans-unit.target: A simple volume consists of a single region on a disk or multiple regions that are linked together on the same disk.

trans-unit.source: (You can create simple volumes only on dynamic disks.) Simple volumes are not fault tolerant.
trans-unit.target: (You can create simple volumes only on dynamic disks.) Simple volumes are not fault tolerant.

trans-unit.source: **Dynamic volumes** – A dynamic volume is a volume created on a dynamic disk.
trans-unit.target: **Dynamic volumes** – A dynamic volume is a volume created on a dynamic disk.

trans-unit.source: Dynamic disks use a database to track information about volumes that are contained on dynamic disks in a computer.
trans-unit.target: Dynamic disks use a database to track information about volumes that are contained on dynamic disks in a computer.

trans-unit.source: **Dynamic volumes with mirroring** – Dynamic volumes with mirroring are built on the RAID 1 architecture.
trans-unit.target: **Dynamic volumes with mirroring** – Dynamic volumes with mirroring are built on the RAID 1 architecture.

trans-unit.source: With RAID 1, identical data is written on two or more disk, producing a mirrored set.
trans-unit.target: With RAID 1, identical data is written on two or more disk, producing a mirrored set.

trans-unit.source: A read request can then be handled by any disk that contains the requested data.
trans-unit.target: A read request can then be handled by any disk that contains the requested data.

trans-unit.source: **Cluster-shared volumes** – With cluster-shared volumes (CSVs), multiple nodes in a failover cluster can simultaneously read or write to the same disk.
trans-unit.target: **Cluster-shared volumes** – With cluster-shared volumes (CSVs), multiple nodes in a failover cluster can simultaneously read or write to the same disk.

trans-unit.source: Failover from one node to another node can occur quickly, without requiring a change in drive ownership or mounting, dismounting, and removing a volume.
trans-unit.target: Failover from one node to another node can occur quickly, without requiring a change in drive ownership or mounting, dismounting, and removing a volume.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Do not mix CSVs and non-CSVs in the same snapshot.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Do not mix CSVs and non-CSVs in the same snapshot.

trans-unit.source: Mixing CSVs and non-CSVs in a snapshot is not supported.
trans-unit.target: Mixing CSVs and non-CSVs in a snapshot is not supported.

trans-unit.source: You can use StorSimple Snapshot Manager to restore entire volume groups or clone individual volumes and recover individual files.
trans-unit.target: You can use StorSimple Snapshot Manager to restore entire volume groups or clone individual volumes and recover individual files.

trans-unit.source: Volumes and volume groups
trans-unit.target: Volumes and volume groups

trans-unit.source: With StorSimple Snapshot Manager, you create volumes and then configure them into volume groups.
trans-unit.target: With StorSimple Snapshot Manager, you create volumes and then configure them into volume groups.

trans-unit.source: StorSimple Snapshot Manager uses volume groups to create backup copies that are application-consistent.
trans-unit.target: StorSimple Snapshot Manager uses volume groups to create backup copies that are application-consistent.

trans-unit.source: Application consistency exists when all related files and databases are synchronized and represent the true state of an application at a specific point in time.
trans-unit.target: Application consistency exists when all related files and databases are synchronized and represent the true state of an application at a specific point in time.

trans-unit.source: Volume groups (which are also known as *consistency groups*) form the basis of a backup or restore job.
trans-unit.target: Volume groups (which are also known as *consistency groups*) form the basis of a backup or restore job.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Volume groups are not the same as volume containers.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Volume groups are not the same as volume containers.

trans-unit.source: A volume container contains one or more volumes that share a cloud storage account and other attributes, such as encryption and bandwidth consumption.
trans-unit.target: A volume container contains one or more volumes that share a cloud storage account and other attributes, such as encryption and bandwidth consumption.

trans-unit.source: A single volume container can contain up to 256 thinly provisioned StorSimple volumes.
trans-unit.target: A single volume container can contain up to 256 thinly provisioned StorSimple volumes.

trans-unit.source: For more information about volume containers, go to [Manage your volume containers](storsimple-manage-volume-containers.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about volume containers, go to [Manage your volume containers](storsimple-manage-volume-containers.md).

trans-unit.source: Volume groups are collections of volumes that you configure to facilitate backup operations.
trans-unit.target: Volume groups are collections of volumes that you configure to facilitate backup operations.

trans-unit.source: If you select two volumes that belong to different volume containers, place them in a single volume group, and then create a backup policy for that volume group, each volume will be backed up in the appropriate volume container, using the appropriate storage account.
trans-unit.target: If you select two volumes that belong to different volume containers, place them in a single volume group, and then create a backup policy for that volume group, each volume will be backed up in the appropriate volume container, using the appropriate storage account.

trans-unit.source: Integration with Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service
trans-unit.target: Integration with Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service

trans-unit.source: StorSimple Snapshot Manager uses the Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) to capture application-consistent data.
trans-unit.target: StorSimple Snapshot Manager uses the Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) to capture application-consistent data.

trans-unit.source: VSS facilitates application consistency by communicating with VSS-aware applications to coordinate the creation of incremental snapshots.
trans-unit.target: VSS facilitates application consistency by communicating with VSS-aware applications to coordinate the creation of incremental snapshots.

trans-unit.source: VSS ensures that the applications are temporarily inactive, or quiescent, when snapshots are taken.
trans-unit.target: VSS ensures that the applications are temporarily inactive, or quiescent, when snapshots are taken.

trans-unit.source: The StorSimple Snapshot Manager implementation of VSS works with SQL Server and generic NTFS volumes.
trans-unit.target: The StorSimple Snapshot Manager implementation of VSS works with SQL Server and generic NTFS volumes.

trans-unit.source: The process is as follows:
trans-unit.target: The process is as follows:

trans-unit.source: A requestor, which is typically a data management and protection solution (such as StorSimple Snapshot Manager) or a backup application, invokes VSS and asks it to gather information from the writer software in the target application.
trans-unit.target: A requestor, which is typically a data management and protection solution (such as StorSimple Snapshot Manager) or a backup application, invokes VSS and asks it to gather information from the writer software in the target application.

trans-unit.source: VSS contacts the writer component to retrieve a description of the data.
trans-unit.target: VSS contacts the writer component to retrieve a description of the data.

trans-unit.source: The writer returns the description of the data to be backed up.
trans-unit.target: The writer returns the description of the data to be backed up.

trans-unit.source: VSS signals the writer to prepare the application for backup.
trans-unit.target: VSS signals the writer to prepare the application for backup.

trans-unit.source: The writer prepares the data for backup by completing open transactions, updating transaction logs, and so on, and then notifies VSS.
trans-unit.target: The writer prepares the data for backup by completing open transactions, updating transaction logs, and so on, and then notifies VSS.

trans-unit.source: VSS instructs the writer to temporarily stop the application's data stores and make sure that no data is written to the volume while the shadow copy is created.
trans-unit.target: VSS instructs the writer to temporarily stop the application's data stores and make sure that no data is written to the volume while the shadow copy is created.

trans-unit.source: This step ensures data consistency, and takes no more than 60 seconds.
trans-unit.target: This step ensures data consistency, and takes no more than 60 seconds.

trans-unit.source: VSS instructs the provider to create the shadow copy.
trans-unit.target: VSS instructs the provider to create the shadow copy.

trans-unit.source: Providers, which can be software- or hardware-based, manage the volumes that are currently running and create shadow copies of them on demand.
trans-unit.target: Providers, which can be software- or hardware-based, manage the volumes that are currently running and create shadow copies of them on demand.

trans-unit.source: The provider creates the shadow copy, and notifies VSS when it is completed.
trans-unit.target: The provider creates the shadow copy, and notifies VSS when it is completed.

trans-unit.source: VSS contacts the writer to notify the application that I/O can resume and also to confirm that I/O was paused successfully during shadow copy creation.
trans-unit.target: VSS contacts the writer to notify the application that I/O can resume and also to confirm that I/O was paused successfully during shadow copy creation.

trans-unit.source: If the copy was successful, VSS returns the copy's location to the requestor.
trans-unit.target: If the copy was successful, VSS returns the copy's location to the requestor.

trans-unit.source: If data was written while the shadow copy was created, then the backup will be inconsistent.
trans-unit.target: If data was written while the shadow copy was created, then the backup will be inconsistent.

trans-unit.source: VSS deletes the shadow copy and notifies the requestor.
trans-unit.target: VSS deletes the shadow copy and notifies the requestor.

trans-unit.source: The requestor can either repeat the backup process automatically or notify the administrator to retry it at a later time.
trans-unit.target: The requestor can either repeat the backup process automatically or notify the administrator to retry it at a later time.

trans-unit.source: Backup types and backup policies
trans-unit.target: Backup types and backup policies

trans-unit.source: With StorSimple Snapshot Manager, you can back up data and store it locally and in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: With StorSimple Snapshot Manager, you can back up data and store it locally and in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: You can use StorSimple Snapshot Manager to back up data immediately, or you can use a backup policy to create a schedule for taking backups automatically.
trans-unit.target: You can use StorSimple Snapshot Manager to back up data immediately, or you can use a backup policy to create a schedule for taking backups automatically.

trans-unit.source: Backup policies also enable you to specify how many snapshots will be retained.
trans-unit.target: Backup policies also enable you to specify how many snapshots will be retained.

trans-unit.source: Backup types
trans-unit.target: Backup types

trans-unit.source: You can use StorSimple Snapshot Manager to create the following types of backups:
trans-unit.target: You can use StorSimple Snapshot Manager to create the following types of backups:

trans-unit.source: **Local snapshots** – Local snapshots are point-in-time copies of volume data that are stored on the StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: **Local snapshots** – Local snapshots are point-in-time copies of volume data that are stored on the StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: Typically, this type of backup can be created and restored quickly.
trans-unit.target: Typically, this type of backup can be created and restored quickly.

trans-unit.source: You can use a local snapshot as you would a local backup copy.
trans-unit.target: You can use a local snapshot as you would a local backup copy.

trans-unit.source: **Cloud snapshots** – Cloud snapshots are point-in-time copies of volume data that are stored in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: **Cloud snapshots** – Cloud snapshots are point-in-time copies of volume data that are stored in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: A cloud snapshot is equivalent to a snapshot replicated on a different, off-site storage system.
trans-unit.target: A cloud snapshot is equivalent to a snapshot replicated on a different, off-site storage system.

trans-unit.source: Cloud snapshots are particularly useful in disaster recovery scenarios.
trans-unit.target: Cloud snapshots are particularly useful in disaster recovery scenarios.

trans-unit.source: On-demand and scheduled backups
trans-unit.target: On-demand and scheduled backups

trans-unit.source: With StorSimple Snapshot Manager, you can initiate a one-time backup to be created immediately, or you can use a backup policy to schedule recurring backup operations.
trans-unit.target: With StorSimple Snapshot Manager, you can initiate a one-time backup to be created immediately, or you can use a backup policy to schedule recurring backup operations.

trans-unit.source: A backup policy is a set of automated rules that you can use to schedule regular backups.
trans-unit.target: A backup policy is a set of automated rules that you can use to schedule regular backups.

trans-unit.source: A backup policy allows you to define the frequency and parameters for taking snapshots of a specific volume group.
trans-unit.target: A backup policy allows you to define the frequency and parameters for taking snapshots of a specific volume group.

trans-unit.source: You can use policies to specify start and expiration dates, times, frequencies, and retention requirements, for both local and cloud snapshots.
trans-unit.target: You can use policies to specify start and expiration dates, times, frequencies, and retention requirements, for both local and cloud snapshots.

trans-unit.source: A policy is applied immediately after you define it.
trans-unit.target: A policy is applied immediately after you define it.

trans-unit.source: You can use StorSimple Snapshot Manager to configure or reconfigure backup policies whenever necessary.
trans-unit.target: You can use StorSimple Snapshot Manager to configure or reconfigure backup policies whenever necessary.

trans-unit.source: You configure the following information for each backup policy that you create:
trans-unit.target: You configure the following information for each backup policy that you create:

trans-unit.source: **Name** – The unique name of the selected backup policy.
trans-unit.target: **Name** – The unique name of the selected backup policy.

trans-unit.source: **Type** – The type of backup policy; either local snapshot or cloud snapshot.
trans-unit.target: **Type** – The type of backup policy; either local snapshot or cloud snapshot.

trans-unit.source: **Volume group** – The volume group to which the selected backup policy is assigned.
trans-unit.target: **Volume group** – The volume group to which the selected backup policy is assigned.

trans-unit.source: **Retention** – The number of backup copies to retain.
trans-unit.target: **Retention** – The number of backup copies to retain.

trans-unit.source: If you check the **All** box, all backup copies are retained until the maximum number of backup copies per volume is reached, at which point the policy will fail and generate an error message.
trans-unit.target: If you check the **All** box, all backup copies are retained until the maximum number of backup copies per volume is reached, at which point the policy will fail and generate an error message.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, you can specify a number of backups to retain (between 1 and 64).
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, you can specify a number of backups to retain (between 1 and 64).

trans-unit.source: **Date** – The date when the backup policy was created.
trans-unit.target: **Date** – The date when the backup policy was created.

trans-unit.source: For information about configuring backup policies, go to [Use StorSimple Snapshot Manager to create and manage backup policies](storsimple-snapshot-manager-manage-backup-policies.md).
trans-unit.target: For information about configuring backup policies, go to [Use StorSimple Snapshot Manager to create and manage backup policies](storsimple-snapshot-manager-manage-backup-policies.md).

trans-unit.source: Backup job monitoring and management
trans-unit.target: Backup job monitoring and management

trans-unit.source: You can use the StorSimple Snapshot Manager to monitor and manage upcoming, scheduled, and completed backup jobs.
trans-unit.target: You can use the StorSimple Snapshot Manager to monitor and manage upcoming, scheduled, and completed backup jobs.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, StorSimple Snapshot Manager provides a catalog of up to 64 completed backups.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, StorSimple Snapshot Manager provides a catalog of up to 64 completed backups.

trans-unit.source: You can use the catalog to find and restore volumes or individual files.
trans-unit.target: You can use the catalog to find and restore volumes or individual files.

trans-unit.source: For information about monitoring backup jobs, go to [Use StorSimple Snapshot Manager to view and manage backup jobs](storsimple-snapshot-manager-manage-backup-jobs.md).
trans-unit.target: For information about monitoring backup jobs, go to [Use StorSimple Snapshot Manager to view and manage backup jobs](storsimple-snapshot-manager-manage-backup-jobs.md).
